{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3462624,"name":"AfterTen","username":"AfterTen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/afterten/{size}/11780_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-23T00:54:37.529Z","cooked":"

So I’m downloading all the beta stuff for FRC 2025 and right now it looks like either things just aren’t all working, which would be expected at this point. or I’m missing something.

Right now it looks like the 2025 Beta Visual Studio is only making available REVLib 2025.0.0-beta-3

But it looks like that library is expecting beta firmware on SparkMax controllers.

Running a robot program I get this error on every SparkMax…
“CANSparkMax object created for CAN ID 3, which is not a SparkMax”
or
“Unable to retrieve SparkMax firmware version”

So things are just, in general, not working right now or I don’t know how to apply beta firmware to the SparkMax controllers.

There is beta firmware available on their GIT but I see no way to apply it using REV Hardware Client.

As typically happens found what is probably the answer to my own question here, moments after I posted…

github.com

wpilibsuite/2025Beta/blob/main/REV.md

# REV Beta Software

## Updating to REV Hardware Client v1.7.0-frcBeta2025.1

  1. Open the current version of the Hardware Client or install it [here](https://github.com/REVrobotics/REV-Software-Binaries/releases/download/rhc-1.6.6/REV-Hardware-Client-Setup-1.6.6.exe).
  2. Navigate to the "Downloads" tab.
  3. Under the section "Subscribe to Software Channels", paste the following code into the text box: `frcBeta2025`.
  4. Click "Add".
  5. A popup will appear prompting you to update. Click "Download Update".

## Updating firmware

The following latest firmwares will be available to download and install after updating the Hardware Client:

* SPARK MAX v25.0.0-prerelease.9
* SPARK Flex v25.0.0-prerelease.9

Changelogs are available in the Hardware Client.

Yup, this is exactly it. You need to update REV Hardware Client, add the “frc2025beta” channel, then you’ll be able to fetch the updated (beta) firmware to deploy to the controllers

Yes, this fixed the REVLib issue but now I have a CTRE Phoenix issue.

Robot has Pigeon and 4 CANCoders.

Visual Studio has installed Phoenix 6 Beta 25.0.0-beta-3

I have the Beta 3 Firmware on all the CTRE Devices

But, when I try and instantiate a new Pigeon2
new Pigeon2(pigeonCanId);
I get a console error about the API being incorrect.

It was late, maybe the error can be ignored for the time being.
I never checked if the code actually retrieved values from the Pigeon.

I’m getting the same error when I try and instantiate CANCoder objects as well.
